addons.name: Close Proxy Authentication
addons.description:
Provides transparent proxy authentication on your enterprise network.
Close authentication dialog if login on proxy failed.
addons.fullDescription:
Provides transparent proxy authentication on your enterprise network.
Close authentication dialog if login on proxy failed.

addons.name: English (South African) Language Pack
addons.description: Adds South African English language support to the Firefox browser. All interfaces will be translated into South African English.
addons.fullDescription:
Translation of the Firefox user interface into South African English by http://translate.org.za.

If you find missing translations or incorrect translations then visit http://pootle.translate.org.za and please contribute a correction.

addons.name: Random Agent Spoofer
addons.description: Allows the use of various browser profiles (not just the user agent), which it can automatically switch to at random after a chosen period of time has expired. Supports other privacy enhancing options
addons.fullDescription:
17 Nov 14. I hope to have a new release out by the new year

The latest full featured version will always be available on github, with certain features that are not allowed on this site. I am working to fix that but I may end up having to release a limited version on this site

Features

    Allows the user to choose a browser profile at random (From all available profiles or desktop profiles only)
    Allows the user to specify the interval at which the random profiles are chosen. Interval can also be random, a specific time period or per session if not set
    Allows the user to exclude profiles from random selection
    Persistently remembers the users choice of profile and time interval if set in addition to other choices
    Provides a quick toggle to enable/disable the addon via right clicking the icon as well as a checkbox in the UI
    Provides option to toggle notifications of user agent changes
    Allows vendor spoofing that was removed in firefox 24 Github version only
    Sets other privacy attributes such as buildid, oscpu and platform and more
    It has a left click menu of expandable lists to allow users to quickly choose specific profiles
    It has a large list of profiles (nearly 400 at this time)
    Option to limit local dom storage
    Option to disable browser cache
    Option to limit fonts to a standard set (monospace, serif, times new roman)
    Option to limit tab history to two
    Option to disable geolocation support
    Option to disable dns prefetching
    Option to disable link prefetching
    Option to disable webgl
    Option to disable webRTC Github version now, will be available in the next AMO release
    Option to disable canvas element support Github version only
    Option to protect window.name storage Github version only
    Option to set referer header Github version now, will be available in the next AMO release
    Option to set do not track header Github version now, will be available in the next AMO release
    Options to send spoofed headers including via, x-forwarded-for and if-none-match.
    Options to spoof the accept headers: documents, encoding and language (US English) so they match the spoofed profile
    Option to override timezone offset to a random timezone, send nothing, specify one from a list or use the default one Github version only
    Option to spoof screen and window sizes to a specific size or set at random Github version only

Please report any issues or bugs at https://github.com/dillbyrne/random-agent-spoofer/issues

More options will be added as time goes on

If you like this addon please rate it.

If you would like to donate with bitcoin you can use the address below
1L44pgmZpeMsWsd24WgN6SJjEUARG5eY6G

screenshots.caption: Icon showing that spoofing is disabled. The user agent is  default when spoofing is disabled
Left click menu with the user agent tab, showing timer options. The timer only applies to the random user agent options, of which one is selected in this screenshot
The addon has been set to enabled by right clicking the icon. A tooltip showing the current user agent prefixed by random in this case as the user selected the random option
This screen shows the expandable lists which allow for quick navigation and the exclude checkboxes beside the profiles to exclude a profile from inclusion in the random selection
A tooltip displaying a specific selection. In this case it is not prefixed by "Random" to allow the user to differentiate between the two.

Headers tab showing available options.

IP inputs are validated in real time.

Green =  valid
Red =  invalid
Extras tab showing the options available so far
Screen shot showing the github version headers tab
Screen shot showing the github version extras tab

addons.name: Adblock Plus
addons.description:
Blocks annoying video ads on YouTube, Facebook ads, banners and much more.

Adblock Plus blocks all annoying ads, and supports websites by not blocking unobtrusive ads by default (configurable).
addons.fullDescription:
Adblock Plus allows you to regain control of the internet and view the web the way you want to. The add-on is supported by over forty filter subscriptions in dozens of languages which automatically configure it for purposes ranging from removing online advertising to blocking all known malware domains. Adblock Plus also allows you to customize your filters with the assistance of a variety of useful features, including a context option for images, a block tab for Flash and Java objects, and a list of blockable items to remove scripts and stylesheets.

Starting with Adblock Plus 2.0 there is an option in Filter Preferences to allow some non-intrusive advertising. The goal is to support websites using non-intrusive ways to advertise and to encourage more websites to do the same. Read more

screenshots.caption: Easily remove all annoying ads from Firefox.
Adblock Plus can do more than adblocking. Enable powerful features in one click.
Clean up your Facebook experience with Adblock Plus.
Adblock Plus even removes those annoying 30-second video ads on YouTube.
Browse the web as it once used to be.
Please help us by reporting bugs.
You can even create your own blocking lists to customize the web to your exact needs.

addons.name: Mozilla Firefox hotfix
addons.description: This official add-on enables Firefox to provide quick fixes for selected issues.
addons.fullDescription: This official add-on enables Firefox to provide quick fixes for selected issues. There is no need to install this add-on; starting in Firefox 11, it will be automatically installed. For more information, see: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Features/Desktop/Add-on_hotfix
